problem.markdown:
>> 1. The most commonly used and relatively less expensive cell for routine use in IR spectroscopy is: (x) Sodium chloride () Potassium Chloride () Glass Cells () Plastic Cells
>> Materials made of glass are not used for IR measurement because: (x) strongly absorb through out the IR region of the spectrum. () do not absorb through out the IR region of the spectrum. () udergo scattering. () remains unaltered
>> To measure the Spectrum of a compound in the range of 4000 to 400 cm-1 the following plates is used: () Glass plates () Sodium chloride plates (x) Potassium bromide plates () Silica plates
>> Which of the following bonds is expected to have the highest frequency stretch? () carbon-carbon single bond () carbon-carbon double bond (x) carbon-carbon triple bond () carbon-bromine single bond
>> A strong signal at 3300 cm-1 in an IR spectrum indicates presence of (x) alcohol () ether () carbonyl () amine
>> The carbonyl (C=O) stretching frequency appears at: () 740 - 720 (x) 1870 - 1650 () 3640 - 3250 () 1160 - 1030
>> Where in an IR spectrum does a carbon-carbon triple bond show a stretching vibration () 2700 cm-1 () 3100 cm-1 (x) 2100 cm-1 () 3300 cm-1
>> Infrared spectroscopy provides valuable information about () molecular weight () Physical properties () chemical properties (x) functional groups.
>> What determines the intensity of an IR peak absorption in an IR spectrum? () the change in polarizability during vibration () the change in bond length during vibration (x) the change in dipole moment during vibration () the molecular weight of the bonding atoms
>> The most effect method of IR spectroscopy is the: () Dispersion spectrometers () Reflection spectrometers (x) Fourier-Transform spectrometers () Deflection spectrometers
problem.p: >> 1. The most commonly used and relatively less expensive cell for routine use in IR spectroscopy is:
>> Materials made of glass are not used for IR measurement because:

choicegroup.choice: strongly absorb through out the IR region of the spectrum.
do not absorb through out the IR region of the spectrum.
